newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli official's criticism "a joke" - Netanyahu.
newsitem.headline: Israeli official's criticism "a joke" - Netanyahu.

text.p: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dismissed as "a joke" criticism by the deputy finance minister who resigned this week over the Israeli leader's "screw-ups".
The deputy minister, David Magen, quit Netanyahu's 11-month-old government on Tuesday.

"What did this man do for a full year at the finance ministry except renovate his office? Nothing. He criticises the government and the prime minister? It's a joke," Netanyahu said in remarks published by the newspaper Maariv on Thursday.
"I don't want to address these things at all," Netanyahu said.

Magen told Israel Radio on Tuesday he was quitting so he could speak freely on matters that troubled him. He called it "stupid" for the prime minister to agree to give up $50 million in U.S. aid to help Jordan at a time of government budget cuts.

Magen said certain remarks by Netanyahu along with "all sorts of major screw-ups and mistakes" prompted him to quit the ministry job and devote his full efforts to parliament where he is part of Netanyahu's Likud-Gesher-Tsomet faction.
